Sloka: यस्मात्क्षरमतीतोऽहमक्षरादपि चोत्तमः | अतोऽस्मि लोके वेदे च प्रथितः पुरुषोत्तमः ||१५-१८||
EnglishTranslation: 15.18 As I transcend the perishable and am even higher than the imperishable, I am declared to be the highest Purusha in the world and in the Vedas.

Sloka: यो मामेवमसम्मूढो जानाति पुरुषोत्तमम् | स सर्वविद्भजति मां सर्वभावेन भारत ||१५-१९||
EnglishTranslation: 15.19 He who, undeluded, knows Me thus as the highest Purusha, he, knowing all, worships Me with his whole being (heart), O Arjuna.

Sloka: इति गुह्यतमं शास्त्रमिदमुक्तं मयानघ | एतद्बुद्ध्वा बुद्धिमान्स्यात्कृतकृत्यश्च भारत ||१५-२०||
EnglishTranslation: 15.20 Thus, this most secret science has been taught by Me, O sinless one; on knowing this, a man becomes wise, and all his duties are accomplished, O Arjuna.

Sloka: श्रीभगवानुवाच | अभयं सत्त्वसंशुद्धिर्ज्ञानयोगव्यवस्थितिः | दानं दमश्च यज्ञश्च स्वाध्यायस्तप आर्जवम् ||१६-१||
EnglishTranslation: 16.1 The Blessed Lord said Fearlessness, purity of heart, steadfastness in knowledge and Yoga, almsgiving, control of the senses, sacrifice, study of scriptures, austerity and straightforwardness.

Sloka: अहिंसा सत्यमक्रोधस्त्यागः शान्तिरपैशुनम् | दया भूतेष्वलोलुप्त्वं मार्दवं ह्रीरचापलम् ||१६-२||
EnglishTranslation: 16.2 Harmlessness, truth, absence of anger, renunciation, peacefulness, absence of crookedness, compassion towards beings, non-covetousness, gentleness, modesty, absence of fickleness.

Sloka: तेजः क्षमा धृतिः शौचमद्रोहो नातिमानिता | भवन्ति सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातस्य भारत ||१६-३||
EnglishTranslation: 16.3 Vigour, forgiveness, fortitude, purity, absence of hatred, absence of pride these belong to the one born for a divine state, O Arjuna.

Sloka: दम्भो दर्पोऽभिमानश्च क्रोधः पारुष्यमेव च | अज्ञानं चाभिजातस्य पार्थ सम्पदमासुरीम् ||१६-४||
EnglishTranslation: 16.4 Hypocrisy, arrogance and self-conceit, anger and also harshness and ignorance, belong to one who is born for a demoniacal state, O Partha (Arjuna).

Sloka: दैवी सम्पद्विमोक्षाय निबन्धायासुरी मता | मा शुचः सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातोऽसि पाण्डव ||१६-५||
EnglishTranslation: 16.5 The divine nature is deemed conducive to liberation, and the demoniacal to bondage. Grieve not, O Arjuna, thou art born with divine endowments.

Sloka: द्वौ भूतसर्गौ लोकेऽस्मिन्दैव आसुर एव च | दैवो विस्तरशः प्रोक्त आसुरं पार्थ मे शृणु ||१६-६||
EnglishTranslation: 16.6 There are two types of beings in this world, the divine and the demoniacal; the divine has been described at length; hear from Me, O Arjuna, of the demoniacal.

Sloka: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च जना न विदुरासुराः | न शौचं नापि चाचारो न सत्यं तेषु विद्यते ||१६-७||
EnglishTranslation: 16.7 The demoniacal know not what to do and what to refrain from; neither purity, nor right conduct nor truth is found in them.

Sloka: असत्यमप्रतिष्ठं ते जगदाहुरनीश्वरम् | अपरस्परसम्भूतं किमन्यत्कामहैतुकम् ||१६-८||
EnglishTranslation: 16.8 They say, "This universe is without truth, without (moral) basis, without a God, brought about by mutual union, with lust for its cause; what else?"

Sloka: एतां दृष्टिमवष्टभ्य नष्टात्मानोऽल्पबुद्धयः | प्रभवन्त्युग्रकर्माणः क्षयाय जगतोऽहिताः ||१६-९||
EnglishTranslation: 16.9 Holding this view, these ruined souls of small intellect and fierce deeds, come forth as the enemies of the world for its destruction.

Sloka: काममाश्रित्य दुष्पूरं दम्भमानमदान्विताः | मोहाद्गृहीत्वासद्ग्राहान्प्रवर्तन्तेऽशुचिव्रताः ||१६-१०||
EnglishTranslation: 16.10 Filled with insatiable desires, full of hypocrisy, pride and arrogance, holding evil ideas through delusion, they work with impure resolves.

Sloka: चिन्तामपरिमेयां च प्रलयान्तामुपाश्रिताः | कामोपभोगपरमा एतावदिति निश्चिताः ||१६-११||
EnglishTranslation: 16.11 Giving themselves over to immeasurable cares ending only with death, regarding gratification of lust as their highest aim, and feeling sure that that is all.

Sloka: आशापाशशतैर्बद्धाः कामक्रोधपरायणाः | ईहन्ते कामभोगार्थमन्यायेनार्थसञ्चयान् ||१६-१२||
EnglishTranslation: 16.12 Bound by a hundred ties of hope, given over to lust and anger, they strive to obtain by unlawful means hoards to wealth for sensual enjoyments.

Sloka: इदमद्य मया लब्धमिमं प्राप्स्ये मनोरथम् | इदमस्तीदमपि मे भविष्यति पुनर्धनम् ||१६-१३||
EnglishTranslation: 16.13 "This has been gained by me today; this desire of mine I shall fuffil; this is mine and this wealth also shall be mine in future."

Sloka: असौ मया हतः शत्रुर्हनिष्ये चापरानपि | ईश्वरोऽहमहं भोगी सिद्धोऽहं बलवान्सुखी ||१६-१४||
EnglishTranslation: 16.14 "That enemy has been slain by me; and others also I shall slay. I am the lord. I enjoy. I am perfect, powerful and happy."

Sloka: आढ्योऽभिजनवानस्मि कोऽन्योऽस्ति सदृशो मया | यक्ष्ये दास्यामि मोदिष्य इत्यज्ञानविमोहिताः ||१६-१५||
EnglishTranslation: 16.15 "I am rich and born in a noble family. Who else is equal to me? I shall perform sacrifices. I shall give (charity). I shall rejoice," thus deluded by ignorance.

Sloka: अनेकचित्तविभ्रान्ता मोहजालसमावृताः | प्रसक्ताः कामभोगेषु पतन्ति नरकेऽशुचौ ||१६-१६||
EnglishTranslation: 16.16 Bewildered by many a fancy, entangled in the snare of delusion, addicted to the gratification of lust, they fall into a foul hell.

Sloka: आत्मसम्भाविताः स्तब्धा धनमानमदान्विताः | यजन्ते नामयज्ञैस्ते दम्भेनाविधिपूर्वकम् ||१६-१७||
EnglishTranslation: 16.17 Self-conceited, stubborn, filled with the pride and intoxication of wealth, they perform sacrifices in name out of ostentation, contrary to scriptural ordinances.

Sloka: अहंकारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं च संश्रिताः | मामात्मपरदेहेषु प्रद्विषन्तोऽभ्यसूयकाः ||१६-१८||
EnglishTranslation: 16.18 Given over to egoism, power, haughtiness, lust and anger, these malicious people hate Me in their own bodies and in those of others.

Sloka: तानहं द्विषतः क्रुरान्संसारेषु नराधमान् | क्षिपाम्यजस्रमशुभानासुरीष्वेव योनिषु ||१६-१९||
EnglishTranslation: 16.19 Those cruel haters, worst among men in the world, I hurl those evil-doers into the wombs of demons only.

Sloka: आसुरीं योनिमापन्ना मूढा जन्मनि जन्मनि | मामप्राप्यैव कौन्तेय ततो यान्त्यधमां गतिम् ||१६-२०||
EnglishTranslation: 16.20 Entering into demoniacal wombs and deluded, birth after birth, not attaining Me, they thus fall, O Arjuna, into a condition still lower than that.

Sloka: त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मनः | कामः क्रोधस्तथा लोभस्तस्मादेतत्त्रयं त्यजेत् ||१६-२१||
EnglishTranslation: 16.21 Triple is the gate of this hell, destructive of the self lust, anger and greed; therefore one should abandon these three.

Sloka: एतैर्विमुक्तः कौन्तेय तमोद्वारैस्त्रिभिर्नरः | आचरत्यात्मनः श्रेयस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ||१६-२२||
EnglishTranslation: 16.22 A man who is liberated from these three gates to darkness, O Arjuna, practises what is good for him and thus goes to the Supreme Goal.

Sloka: यः शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य वर्तते कामकारतः | न स सिद्धिमवाप्नोति न सुखं न परां गतिम् ||१६-२३||
EnglishTranslation: 16.23 He who, having cast aside the ordinances of the scriptures, acts under the impulse of desire, attains not perfection, nor happiness nor the Supreme Goal.

Sloka: तस्माच्छास्त्रं प्रमाणं ते कार्याकार्यव्यवस्थितौ | ज्ञात्वा शास्त्रविधानोक्तं कर्म कर्तुमिहार्हसि ||१६-२४||
EnglishTranslation: 16.24 Therefore, let the scripture be thy authority in determining what ought to be done and what ought not to be done. Having known what is said in the ordinance of the scriptures, thou shouldst act here in this world.

Sloka: अर्जुन उवाच | ये शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः | तेषां निष्ठा तु का कृष्ण सत्त्वमाहो रजस्तमः ||१७-१||
EnglishTranslation: 17.1 Arjuna said Those who, setting aside the ordinances of the scriptures, perform sacrifice with faith, what is their condition, O Krishna? Is is Sattva, Rajas or Tamas?

Sloka: श्रीभगवानुवाच | त्रिविधा भवति श्रद्धा देहिनां सा स्वभावजा | सात्त्विकी राजसी चैव तामसी चेति तां शृणु ||१७-२||
EnglishTranslation: 17.2 The Blessed Lord said Threefold is the faith of the embodied, which is inherent in their nature the Sattvic (pure), the Rajasic (passionate) and the Tamasic (dark). Do thou hear of it.

Sloka: सत्त्वानुरूपा सर्वस्य श्रद्धा भवति भारत | श्रद्धामयोऽयं पुरुषो यो यच्छ्रद्धः स एव सः ||१७-३||
EnglishTranslation: 17.3 The faith of each is in accordance with his nature, O Arjuna. The man consists of his faith; as a man's faith is, so is he.

Sloka: यजन्ते सात्त्विका देवान्यक्षरक्षांसि राजसाः | प्रेतान्भूतगणांश्चान्ये यजन्ते तामसा जनाः ||१७-४||
EnglishTranslation: 17.4 The Sattvic or the pure men worship the gods; the Rajasic or the passionate worship the Yakshas and the Rakshasas; the others (the Tamasic or the deluded people) worship the ghosts and the hosts of the nature-spirits.

Sloka: अशास्त्रविहितं घोरं तप्यन्ते ये तपो जनाः | दम्भाहंकारसंयुक्ताः कामरागबलान्विताः ||१७-५||
EnglishTranslation: 17.5 Those men who practise terrific austerities not enjoined by the scriptures, given to hypocrisy and egoism, impelled by the force of lust and attachment.

Sloka: कर्षयन्तः शरीरस्थं भूतग्राममचेतसः | मां चैवान्तःशरीरस्थं तान्विद्ध्यासुरनिश्चयान् ||१७-६||
EnglishTranslation: 17.6 Senseless, torturing all the elements in the body and Me also, Who dwell in the body, know thou these to be of demonical resolves.

Sloka: आहारस्त्वपि सर्वस्य त्रिविधो भवति प्रियः | यज्ञस्तपस्तथा दानं तेषां भेदमिमं शृणु ||१७-७||
EnglishTranslation: 17.7 The food also which is dear to each is threefold, as also sacrifice, austerity and almsgiving. Hear thou the distinction of these.

Sloka: आयुःसत्त्वबलारोग्यसुखप्रीतिविवर्धनाः | रस्याः स्निग्धाः स्थिरा हृद्या आहाराः सात्त्विकप्रियाः ||१७-८||
EnglishTranslation: 17.8 The foods which increase life, purity, strength, health, joy and cheerfulness (good appetite), which are savoury and oleaginous, substantial and agreeable, are dear to the Sattvic (pure) people.

Sloka: कट्वम्ललवणात्युष्णतीक्ष्णरूक्षविदाहिनः | आहारा राजसस्येष्टा दुःखशोकामयप्रदाः ||१७-९||
EnglishTranslation: 17.9 The foods that are bitter, sour, saline, excessively hot, pungent, dry and burning, are liked by the Rajasic and are productive of pain, grief and disease.

Sloka: यातयामं गतरसं पूति पर्युषितं च यत् | उच्छिष्टमपि चामेध्यं भोजनं तामसप्रियम् ||१७-१०||
EnglishTranslation: 17.10 That which is state, tasteless, putrid, rotten, refuse and impure, is the food liked by the Tamasic.

Sloka: अफलाङ्क्षिभिर्यज्ञो विधिदृष्टो य इज्यते | यष्टव्यमेवेति मनः समाधाय स सात्त्विकः ||१७-११||
EnglishTranslation: 17.11 That sacrifice which is offered by men without desire for reward as enjoined by the ordinance (scripture), with a firm faith that to do so is a duty, is Sattvic or pure.

Sloka: अभिसन्धाय तु फलं दम्भार्थमपि चैव यत् | इज्यते भरतश्रेष्ठ तं यज्ञं विद्धि राजसम् ||१७-१२||
EnglishTranslation: 17.12 The sacrifice which is offered, O Arjuna, seeking a reward and for ostentation, know thou that to be a Rajasic Yajna.

Sloka: विधिहीनमसृष्टान्नं मन्त्रहीनमदक्षिणम् | श्रद्धाविरहितं यज्ञं तामसं परिचक्षते ||१७-१३||
EnglishTranslation: 17.13 They declare that sacrifice to be Tamasic which is contrary to the ordinances of the scriptures, in which no food is distributed, which is devoid of Mantras, gifts and faith.

Sloka: देवद्विजगुरुप्राज्ञपूजनं शौचमार्जवम् | ब्रह्मचर्यमहिंसा च शारीरं तप उच्यते ||१७-१४||
EnglishTranslation: 17.14 Worship of the gods, the twice-born, the teachers and the wise, purity, straightforwardness, celibacy and non-injury are called the austerities of the body.

Sloka: अनुद्वेगकरं वाक्यं सत्यं प्रियहितं च यत् | स्वाध्यायाभ्यसनं चैव वाङ्मयं तप उच्यते ||१७-१५||
EnglishTranslation: 17.15 Speech which causes no excitement, truthful, pleasant and beneficial, the practice of the study of the Vedas, are called austerity of speech.

Sloka: मनः प्रसादः सौम्यत्वं मौनमात्मविनिग्रहः | भावसंशुद्धिरित्येतत्तपो मानसमुच्यते ||१७-१६||
EnglishTranslation: 17.16 Serenity of mind, good-heartedness, self-control, purity of nature this is called mental austerity.

Sloka: श्रद्धया परया तप्तं तपस्तत्त्रिविधं नरैः | अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्युक्तैः सात्त्विकं परिचक्षते ||१७-१७||
EnglishTranslation: 17.17 This threefold austerity, practised by steadfast men, with the utmost faith, desiring no reward, they call Sattvic.

Sloka: सत्कारमानपूजार्थं तपो दम्भेन चैव यत् | क्रियते तदिह प्रोक्तं राजसं चलमध्रुवम् ||१७-१८||
EnglishTranslation: 17.18 The austerity which is practised with the object of gaining good reception, honour and worship, and with hypocrisy, is here said to be Rajasic, unstable and transitory.

Sloka: मूढग्राहेणात्मनो यत्पीडया क्रियते तपः | परस्योत्सादनार्थं वा तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ||१७-१९||
EnglishTranslation: 17.19 That austerity which is practised out of a foolish notion, with self-torture, or for the purpose of destroying another, is declared to be Tamasic.

Sloka: दातव्यमिति यद्दानं दीयतेऽनुपकारिणे | देशे काले च पात्रे च तद्दानं सात्त्विकं स्मृतम् ||१७-२०||
EnglishTranslation: 17.20 That gift which is given to one who does nothing in return, knowing it to be a duty to give in a fit place and time to a worthy person, that gift is held to be Sattvic.

Sloka: यत्तु प्रत्युपकारार्थं फलमुद्दिश्य वा पुनः | दीयते च परिक्लिष्टं तद्दानं राजसं स्मृतम् ||१७-२१||
EnglishTranslation: 17.21 And, that gift which is given with a view to receive something in return, or looking for a reward, or reluctantly, is held to be Rajasic.

Sloka: अदेशकाले यद्दानमपात्रेभ्यश्च दीयते | असत्कृतमवज्ञातं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ||१७-२२||
EnglishTranslation: 17.22 The gift that is given at a wrong place and time, to unworthy persons, without respect or with insult is declared to be Tamasic.

Sloka: ॐतत्सदिति निर्देशो ब्रह्मणस्त्रिविधः स्मृतः | ब्राह्मणास्तेन वेदाश्च यज्ञाश्च विहिताः पुरा ||१७-२३||
EnglishTranslation: 17.23 "Om Tat Sat": This has been declared to be the triple designation of Brahman. By that were created formerly, the Brahmanas, the Vedas and the sacrifices.

Sloka: तस्मादोमित्युदाहृत्य यज्ञदानतपःक्रियाः | प्रवर्तन्ते विधानोक्ताः सततं ब्रह्मवादिनाम् ||१७-२४||
EnglishTranslation: 17.24 Therefore, with the utterance of "Om" are the acts of sacrifice, gift and austerity as enjoined in the scriptures, always begun by the students of Brahman.

Sloka: तदित्यनभिसन्धाय फलं यज्ञतपःक्रियाः | दानक्रियाश्च विविधाः क्रियन्ते मोक्षकाङ्क्षिभिः ||१७-२५||
EnglishTranslation: 17.25 Uttering ï1Tatï1, without aiming at the fruits, are the acts of sacrifice and austerity and the various acts of gifts performed by the seekers of liberation.

Sloka: सद्भावे साधुभावे च सदित्येतत्प्रयुज्यते | प्रशस्ते कर्मणि तथा सच्छब्दः पार्थ युज्यते ||१७-२६||
EnglishTranslation: 17.26 The word ï1Satï1 is used in the sense of reality and of goodness; and so also, O Arjuna, the word ï1Satï1 is used in the sense of an auspicious act.

Sloka: यज्ञे तपसि दाने च स्थितिः सदिति चोच्यते | कर्म चैव तदर्थीयं सदित्येवाभिधीयते ||१७-२७||
EnglishTranslation: 17.27 Steadfastness in sacrifice, austerity and gift, is also called 'Sat' and also action in connection with these (or for the sake of the Supreme) is called 'Sat'.

Sloka: अश्रद्धया हुतं दत्तं तपस्तप्तं कृतं च यत् | असदित्युच्यते पार्थ न च तत्प्रेत्य नो इह ||१७-२८||
EnglishTranslation: 17.28 Whatever is sacrificed, given or performed, and whatever austerity is practised without faith, it is called 'Asat', O Arjuna; it is naught here or hereafter (after death).

Sloka: अर्जुन उवाच | संन्यासस्य महाबाहो तत्त्वमिच्छामि वेदितुम् | त्यागस्य च हृषीकेश पृथक्केशिनिषूदन ||१८-१||
EnglishTranslation: 18.1 Arjuna said I desire to know severally, O mighty-armed, the essence or truth of renunciation, O Hrishikesa, as also of abandonment, O slayer of Kesi.

Sloka: श्रीभगवानुवाच | काम्यानां कर्मणां न्यासं संन्यासं कवयो विदुः | सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं प्राहुस्त्यागं विचक्षणाः ||१८-२||
EnglishTranslation: 18.2 The Blessed Lord said The sages understand Sannyasa to be the renunciation of action with desire; the wise declare the abandonment of the fruits of all actions as Tyaga.

Sloka: त्याज्यं दोषवदित्येके कर्म प्राहुर्मनीषिणः | यज्ञदानतपःकर्म न त्याज्यमिति चापरे ||१८-३||
EnglishTranslation: 18.3 Some philosophers declare that actions should be abandoned as an evil; while others (declare) that acts of sacrifice, gift and austerity should not be relinished.

Sloka: निश्चयं शृणु मे तत्र त्यागे भरतसत्तम | त्यागो हि पुरुषव्याघ्र त्रिविधः सम्प्रकीर्तितः ||१८-४||
EnglishTranslation: 18.4 Hear from Me the conclusion or the final truth about this abandonment, O best of the Bharatas; abandonment, verily, O best of men, has been declared to be of three kinds.

Sloka: यज्ञदानतपःकर्म न त्याज्यं कार्यमेव तत् | यज्ञो दानं तपश्चैव पावनानि मनीषिणाम् ||१८-५||
EnglishTranslation: 18.5 Acts of sacrifice, gift and austerity should not be abandoned, but should be performed; sacrifice, gift and also austerity are the purifiers of the wise.

Sloka: एतान्यपि तु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलानि च | कर्तव्यानीति मे पार्थ निश्चितं मतमुत्तमम् ||१८-६||
EnglishTranslation: 18.6 But even these actions should be performed leaving aside attachment and the desire for rewards, O Arjuna; this is My certain and best conviction.

Sloka: नियतस्य तु संन्यासः कर्मणो नोपपद्यते | मोहात्तस्य परित्यागस्तामसः परिकीर्तितः ||१८-७||
EnglishTranslation: 18.7 Verily the renunciation of obligatory action is not proper; the abandonment of the same from delusion is declared to be Tamasic.

Sloka: दुःखमित्येव यत्कर्म कायक्लेशभयात्त्यजेत् | स कृत्वा राजसं त्यागं नैव त्यागफलं लभेत् ||१८-८||
EnglishTranslation: 18.8 He who abandons action on account of the fear of bodily trouble (because it is painful), does not obtain the merit of renunciation by doing such Rajasic renunciation.

Sloka: कार्यमित्येव यत्कर्म नियतं क्रियतेऽर्जुन | सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलं चैव स त्यागः सात्त्विको मतः ||१८-९||
EnglishTranslation: 18.9 Whatever obligatory action is done, O Arjuna, merely because it ought to be done, abandoning attachment and also the desire for reward, that renunciation is regarded as Sattvic (pure).

Sloka: न द्वेष्ट्यकुशलं कर्म कुशले नानुषज्जते | त्यागी सत्त्वसमाविष्टो मेधावी छिन्नसंशयः ||१८-१०||
EnglishTranslation: 18.10 The man of renunciation, pervaded by purity, intelligent, and with his doubts cut asunder, does not hate a disagreeable work nor is he attached to an agreeable one.

Sloka: न हि देहभृता शक्यं त्यक्तुं कर्माण्यशेषतः | यस्तु कर्मफलत्यागी स त्यागीत्यभिधीयते ||१८-११||
EnglishTranslation: 18.11 Verily, it is not possible for an embodied being to abandon actions entirely; but he who relinishes the rewards of actions is verily called a man of renunciation.

Sloka: अनिष्टमिष्टं मिश्रं च त्रिविधं कर्मणः फलम् | भवत्यत्यागिनां प्रेत्य न तु संन्यासिनां क्वचित् ||१८-१२||
EnglishTranslation: 18.12 The threefold fruit of action (evil, good and mixed) accrues after death to the non-abandoners, but never to the abandoners.

Sloka: पञ्चैतानि महाबाहो कारणानि निबोध मे | साङ्ख्ये कृतान्ते प्रोक्तानि सिद्धये सर्वकर्मणाम् ||१८-१३||
EnglishTranslation: 18.13 Learn from Me, O mighty-armed Arjuna, these five causes as declared in the Sankhya system for the accomplishment of all actions.

Sloka: अधिष्ठानं तथा कर्ता करणं च पृथग्विधम् | विविधाश्च पृथक्चेष्टा दैवं चैवात्र पञ्चमम् ||१८-१४||
EnglishTranslation: 18.14 The seat (body), the doer, the various senses, the different functions of various sorts, and the presiding deity, also, the fifth.

Sloka: शरीरवाङ्मनोभिर्यत्कर्म प्रारभते नरः | न्याय्यं वा विपरीतं वा पञ्चैते तस्य हेतवः ||१८-१५||
EnglishTranslation: 18.15 Whatever action a man performs with his body, speech and mind whether right or the reverse these five are its causes.

Sloka: तत्रैवं सति कर्तारमात्मानं केवलं तु यः | पश्यत्यकृतबुद्धित्वान्न स पश्यति दुर्मतिः ||१८-१६||
EnglishTranslation: 18.16 Now, such being the case, verily he who owing to untrained understanding looks upon his Self, which is isolated, as the agent, he of perverted intelligence, sees not.

Sloka: यस्य नाहंकृतो भावो बुद्धिर्यस्य न लिप्यते | हत्वाऽपि स इमाँल्लोकान्न हन्ति न निबध्यते ||१८-१७||
EnglishTranslation: 18.17 He who is free from the egoistic notion, whose intelligence is not tainted (by good or evil), though he slays these people, he slayeth not, nor is he bound (by the action).

Sloka: ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं परिज्ञाता त्रिविधा कर्मचोदना | करणं कर्म कर्तेति त्रिविधः कर्मसंग्रहः ||१८-१८||
EnglishTranslation: 18.18 Knowledge, the knowable and the knower form the threefold impulse to action; the organ, the action and the agent form the threefold basis of action.

Sloka: ज्ञानं कर्म च कर्ताच त्रिधैव गुणभेदतः | प्रोच्यते गुणसङ्ख्याने यथावच्छृणु तान्यपि ||१८-१९||
EnglishTranslation: 18.19 Knowledge, action and actor are declared in the science of the Gunas (Sankhya philosophy) to be of three kinds only, according to the distinction of the Gunas. Of these also, hear duly.

Sloka: सर्वभूतेषु येनैकं भावमव्ययमीक्षते | अविभक्तं विभक्तेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि सात्त्विकम् ||१८-२०||
EnglishTranslation: 18.20 That by which one sees the one indestructible Reality in all beings, not separate in all the separate beings know thou that knowledge to be Sattvic.

Sloka: पृथक्त्वेन तु यज्ज्ञानं नानाभावान्पृथग्विधान् | वेत्ति सर्वेषु भूतेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि राजसम् ||१८-२१||
EnglishTranslation: 18.21 But that knowledge which sees in all beings various entities of distinct kinds as different from one another know thou that knowledge to be Rajasic.

Sloka: यत्तु कृत्स्नवदेकस्मिन्कार्ये सक्तमहैतुकम् | अतत्त्वार्थवदल्पं च तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ||१८-२२||
EnglishTranslation: 18.22 But that which clings to one single effect as if it were the whole, without reason, without foundation in Truth, and trivial that is declared to be Tamasic.

Sloka: नियतं सङ्गरहितमरागद्वेषतः कृतम् | अफलप्रेप्सुना कर्म यत्तत्सात्त्विकमुच्यते ||१८-२३||
EnglishTranslation: 18.23 An action which is ordained, which is free from attachment, and which is done without love or hatred by one who is not desirous of any reward that action is declared to be Sattvic.

Sloka: यत्तु कामेप्सुना कर्म साहंकारेण वा पुनः | क्रियते बहुलायासं तद्राजसमुदाहृतम् ||१८-२४||
EnglishTranslation: 18.24 But that action which is done by one longing for the fulfilment of desires or gain with egoism or with much effort that is declared to be Rajasic (passionate).

Sloka: अनुबन्धं क्षयं हिंसामनपेक्ष्य च पौरुषम् | मोहादारभ्यते कर्म यत्तत्तामसमुच्यते ||१८-२५||
EnglishTranslation: 18.25 That action which is undertaken from delusion, without a regard for the conseences, loss, injury and (one's own) ability that is declared to be Tamasic (dark).

Sloka: मुक्तसङ्गोऽनहंवादी धृत्युत्साहसमन्वितः | सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योर्निर्विकारः कर्ता सात्त्विक उच्यते ||१८-२६||
EnglishTranslation: 18.26 An agent who is free from attachment, non-egoistic, endowed with firmness and enthusiasm, and unaffected by success or failure, is called Sattvic (pure).

Sloka: रागी कर्मफलप्रेप्सुर्लुब्धो हिंसात्मकोऽशुचिः | हर्षशोकान्वितः कर्ता राजसः परिकीर्तितः ||१८-२७||
EnglishTranslation: 18.27 Passionate, desiring to obtain the reward of actions, greedy, cruel, impure, moved by joy and sorrow, such an agent is said to be Rajasic (passionate).

Sloka: अयुक्तः प्राकृतः स्तब्धः शठो नैष्कृतिकोऽलसः | विषादी दीर्घसूत्री च कर्ता तामस उच्यते ||१८-२८||
EnglishTranslation: 18.28 Unsteady, vulgar, unbending, cheating, malicious, lazy, desponding and procrastinating such an agent is called Tamasic.

Sloka: बुद्धेर्भेदं धृतेश्चैव गुणतस्त्रिविधं शृणु | प्रोच्यमानमशेषेण पृथक्त्वेन धनञ्जय ||१८-२९||
EnglishTranslation: 18.29 Hear thou the threefold division of intellect and firmness according to the Gunas, as I declare them fully and distinctly, O Arjuna.

Sloka: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च कार्याकार्ये भयाभये | बन्धं मोक्षं च या वेत्ति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी ||१८-३०||
EnglishTranslation: 18.30 The intellect which knows the path of work and renunciation, what ought to be done and what ought not to be done, fear and fearlessness, bondage and liberation that intellect is Sattvic (pure), O Arjuna.

Sloka: यया धर्ममधर्मं च कार्यं चाकार्यमेव च | अयथावत्प्रजानाति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ राजसी ||१८-३१||
EnglishTranslation: 18.31 That, by which one wrongly understands Dharma and Adharma and also what ought to be done and what ought not to be done that intellect, O Arjuna, is Rajasic (passionate).

Sloka: अधर्मं धर्ममिति या मन्यते तमसावृता | सर्वार्थान्विपरीतांश्च बुद्धिः सा पार्थ तामसी ||१८-३२||
EnglishTranslation: 18.32 That, which, enveloped in darkness, sees Adharma as Dharma and all things perverted that intellect, O Arjuna, is Tamasic (dark).

Sloka: धृत्या यया धारयते मनःप्राणेन्द्रियक्रियाः | योगेनाव्यभिचारिण्या धृतिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी ||१८-३३||
EnglishTranslation: 18.33 The unwavering firmness by which, through Yoga, the functions of the mind, the life-force and the senses are restrained that firmness, O Arjuna, is Sattvic (pure).

Sloka: यया तु धर्मकामार्थान्धृत्या धारयतेऽर्जुन | प्रसङ्गेन फलाकाङ्क्षी धृतिः सा पार्थ राजसी ||१८-३४||
EnglishTranslation: 18.34 But that, O Arjuna, by which, on account of attachment and desire for reward, one holds fast to Dharma (duty), enjoyment of pleasures and earning of wealth that firmness, O Arjuna, is Rajasic (passionate).

Sloka: यया स्वप्नं भयं शोकं विषादं मदमेव च | न विमुञ्चति दुर्मेधा धृतिः सा पार्थ तामसी ||१८-३५||
EnglishTranslation: 18.35 That, by which a stupid man does not abandon sleep, fear, grief, despair and also conceit that firmness, O Arjuna, is Tamasic.

Sloka: सुखं त्विदानीं त्रिविधं शृणु मे भरतर्षभ | अभ्यासाद्रमते यत्र दुःखान्तं च निगच्छति ||१८-३६||
EnglishTranslation: 18.36 And now hear from Me, O Arjuna, of the threefold pleasure, in which one rejoices by practice and surely comes to the end of pain.

Sloka: यत्तदग्रे विषमिव परिणामेऽमृतोपमम् | तत्सुखं सात्त्विकं प्रोक्तमात्मबुद्धिप्रसादजम् ||१८-३७||
EnglishTranslation: 18.37 That which is like poison at first but in the end like nectar that happiness is declared to be Sattvic, born of the purity of one's own mind due to Self-realisation.

Sloka: विषयेन्द्रियसंयोगाद्यत्तदग्रेऽमृतोपमम् | परिणामे विषमिव तत्सुखं राजसं स्मृतम् ||१८-३८||
EnglishTranslation: 18.38 That happiness which arises from the contact of the sense-organs with the objects, which is at first like nectar, and in the end like poison that is declared to be Rajasic.

Sloka: यदग्रे चानुबन्धे च सुखं मोहनमात्मनः | निद्रालस्यप्रमादोत्थं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ||१८-३९||
EnglishTranslation: 18.39 That happiness which at first as well as in the seel deludes the self, and which arises from sleep, indolence and heedlessness that is declared to be Tamasic.

Sloka: न तदस्ति पृथिव्यां वा दिवि देवेषु वा पुनः | सत्त्वं प्रकृतिजैर्मुक्तं यदेभिः स्यात्त्रिभिर्गुणैः ||१८-४०||
EnglishTranslation: 18.40 There is no being on earth or again in heaven among the gods, that is liberated from the three alities born of Nature.

Sloka: ब्राह्मणक्षत्रियविशां शूद्राणां च परन्तप | कर्माणि प्रविभक्तानि स्वभावप्रभवैर्गुणैः ||१८-४१||
EnglishTranslation: 18.41 Of Brahmanas, Kshatriyas and Vaisyas, as also of Sudras, O Arjuna, the duties are distributed according to the alities born of their own nature.

Sloka: शमो दमस्तपः शौचं क्षान्तिरार्जवमेव च | ज्ञानं विज्ञानमास्तिक्यं ब्रह्मकर्म स्वभावजम् ||१८-४२||
EnglishTranslation: 18.42 Serenity, self-restraint, austerity, purity, forgiveness and also uprightness, knowledge, realisation and belief in God are the duties of the Brahmanas, born of (their own) nature.

Sloka: शौर्यं तेजो धृतिर्दाक्ष्यं युद्धे चाप्यपलायनम् | दानमीश्वरभावश्च क्षात्रं कर्म स्वभावजम् ||१८-४३||
EnglishTranslation: 18.43 Prowess, splendour, firmness, dexterity and also not fleeing from battle, generosity and lordliness are the duties of the Kshatriyas, born of (their own) nature.

Sloka: कृषिगौरक्ष्यवाणिज्यं वैश्यकर्म स्वभावजम् | परिचर्यात्मकं कर्म शूद्रस्यापि स्वभावजम् ||१८-४४||
EnglishTranslation: 18.44 Agriculture, cattle-rearing and trade are the duties of the Vaisya (merchant), born of (their own) nature; and action consisting of service is the duty of the Sudra (servant-class), born of (their own) nature.

Sloka: स्वे स्वे कर्मण्यभिरतः संसिद्धिं लभते नरः | स्वकर्मनिरतः सिद्धिं यथा विन्दति तच्छृणु ||१८-४५||
EnglishTranslation: 5.10 He who does actions, offering them to Brahman, and abandoning attachment, is not tainted by sin, just as a lotus-leaf is not tainted by water.

Sloka: यतः प्रवृत्तिर्भूतानां येन सर्वमिदं ततम् | स्वकर्मणा तमभ्यर्च्य सिद्धिं विन्दति मानवः ||१८-४६||
EnglishTranslation: 18.46 He from Whom all the beings have evolved and by Whom all this is pervaded worshipping Him with his own duty, man attains perfection.

Sloka: श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात् | स्वभावनियतं कर्म कुर्वन्नाप्नोति किल्बिषम् ||१८-४७||
EnglishTranslation: 18.47 Better is one's own duty (though) destitute of merits, than the duty of another well performed. He who does the duty ordained by his own nature incurs no sin.

Sloka: सहजं कर्म कौन्तेय सदोषमपि न त्यजेत् | सर्वारम्भा हि दोषेण धूमेनाग्निरिवावृताः ||१८-४८||
EnglishTranslation: 18.48 One should not abandon, O Arjuna, the duty to which one is born, though faulty; for, all undertakings are enveloped by evil, as fire by smoke.

Sloka: असक्तबुद्धिः सर्वत्र जितात्मा विगतस्पृहः | नैष्कर्म्यसिद्धिं परमां संन्यासेनाधिगच्छति ||१८-४९||
EnglishTranslation: 18.49 He whose intellect is unattached everywhere, who has subdued his self, from whom desire has fled, he by renunciation, attains the supreme state of freedom from action.

Sloka: सिद्धिं प्राप्तो यथा ब्रह्म तथाप्नोति निबोध मे | समासेनैव कौन्तेय निष्ठा ज्ञानस्य या परा ||१८-५०||
EnglishTranslation: 18.50 Learn from Me in brief, O Arjuna, how he who has attained perfection reaches Brahman (the Eternal), that supreme state of knowledge.

Sloka: बुद्ध्या विशुद्धया युक्तो धृत्यात्मानं नियम्य च | शब्दादीन्विषयांस्त्यक्त्वा रागद्वेषौ व्युदस्य च ||१८-५१||
EnglishTranslation: 18.51 Endowed with a pure intellect, controlling the self by firmness, relinishing sound and other objects and abandoning attraction and hatred.

Sloka: विविक्तसेवी लघ्वाशी यतवाक्कायमानसः | ध्यानयोगपरो नित्यं वैराग्यं समुपाश्रितः ||१८-५२||
EnglishTranslation: 18.52 Dwelling in solitude, eating but little, with speech, body and mind subdued, always engaged in meditation and concentration, resorting to dispassion.

Sloka: अहंकारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं परिग्रहम् | विमुच्य निर्ममः शान्तो ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ||१८-५३||
EnglishTranslation: 18.53 Having abandoned egoism, strength, arrogance, desire, anger and covetousness, and free from the notion of 'mine' and peaceful, he is fit for becoming Brahman.

Sloka: ब्रह्मभूतः प्रसन्नात्मा न शोचति न काङ्क्षति | समः सर्वेषु भूतेषु मद्भक्तिं लभते पराम् ||१८-५४||
EnglishTranslation: 18.54 Becoming Brahman, serene in the Self, he neither grieves nor desires, the same to all beings, he obtains supreme devotion to Me.

Sloka: भक्त्या मामभिजानाति यावान्यश्चास्मि तत्त्वतः | ततो मां तत्त्वतो ज्ञात्वा विशते तदनन्तरम् ||१८-५५||
EnglishTranslation: 18.55 By devotion he knows Me in truth, what and who I am; then having known Me in truth, he forthwith enters into the Supreme.

Sloka: सर्वकर्माण्यपि सदा कुर्वाणो मद्व्यपाश्रयः | मत्प्रसादादवाप्नोति शाश्वतं पदमव्ययम् ||१८-५६||
EnglishTranslation: 18.56 Doing all actions always having taken refuge in Me, by My grace he obtains the eternal indestructible state of being.

Sloka: चेतसा सर्वकर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्परः | बुद्धियोगमुपाश्रित्य मच्चित्तः सततं भव ||१८-५७||
EnglishTranslation: 18.57 Mentally renouncing all actions in Me, having Me as the highest goal, resorting to the Yoga of discrimination do thou ever fix thy mind on Me.

Sloka: मच्चित्तः सर्वदुर्गाणि मत्प्रसादात्तरिष्यसि | अथ चेत्त्वमहंकारान्न श्रोष्यसि विनङ्क्ष्यसि ||१८-५८||
EnglishTranslation: 18.58 Fixing thy mind on Me, thou shalt by My grace overcome all obstacles; but if from egoism thou wilt not hear Me, thou shalt perish.

Sloka: यदहंकारमाश्रित्य न योत्स्य इति मन्यसे | मिथ्यैष व्यवसायस्ते प्रकृतिस्त्वां नियोक्ष्यति ||१८-५९||
EnglishTranslation: 18.59 If, filled with egoism, thou thinkest: "I will not fight", vain is this, thy resolve; Nature will compel thee.

Sloka: स्वभावजेन कौन्तेय निबद्धः स्वेन कर्मणा | कर्तुं नेच्छसि यन्मोहात्करिष्यस्यवशोपि तत् ||१८-६०||
EnglishTranslation: 18.60 O Arjuna, bound by thy own Karma (action) born of thy own nature, that which from delusion thou wishest not to do, even that thou shalt do helplessly.

Sloka: ईश्वरः सर्वभूतानां हृद्देशेऽर्जुन तिष्ठति | भ्रामयन्सर्वभूतानि यन्त्रारूढानि मायया ||१८-६१||
EnglishTranslation: 18.61 The Lord dwells in the hearts of all beings, O Arjuna, causing all beings, by His illusive power, to revolve as if mounted on a machine.

Sloka: तमेव शरणं गच्छ सर्वभावेन भारत | तत्प्रसादात्परां शान्तिं स्थानं प्राप्स्यसि शाश्वतम् ||१८-६२||
EnglishTranslation: 18.62 Fly unto Him for refuge with all thy being, O Arjuna; by His grace thou shalt obtain supreme peace (and) the eternal abode.

Sloka: इति ते ज्ञानमाख्यातं गुह्याद्गुह्यतरं मया | विमृश्यैतदशेषेण यथेच्छसि तथा कुरु ||१८-६३||
EnglishTranslation: 18.63 Thus has wisdom, more secret than secrecy itself, been declared unto thee by Me; having reflected over it fully, then act as thou wishest.

Sloka: सर्वगुह्यतमं भूयः शृणु मे परमं वचः | इष्टोऽसि मे दृढमिति ततो वक्ष्यामि ते हितम् ||१८-६४||
EnglishTranslation: 18.64 Hear thou again My supreme word, most secret of all; because thou art dearly beloved of Me, I will tell thee what is good.

Sloka: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु | मामेवैष्यसि सत्यं ते प्रतिजाने प्रियोऽसि मे ||१८-६५||
EnglishTranslation: 18.65 Fix thy mind on Me, by devoted to Me, sacrifice to Me, bow down to Me. Thou shalt come even to Me; truly do I promise unto thee, (for) thou art dear to Me.

Sloka: सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज | अहं त्वा सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः ||१८-६६||
EnglishTranslation: 18.66 Abandoning all duties, take refuge in Me alone: I will liberate thee from all sins; grieve not.

Sloka: इदं ते नातपस्काय नाभक्ताय कदाचन | न चाशुश्रूषवे वाच्यं न च मां योऽभ्यसूयति ||१८-६७||
EnglishTranslation: 18.67 This is never to be spoken by thee to one who is devoid of austerities or devotion, nor to one who does not render service or who does not desire to listen, nor to one who cavils at Me.

Sloka: य इदं परमं गुह्यं मद्भक्तेष्वभिधास्यति | भक्तिं मयि परां कृत्वा मामेवैष्यत्यसंशयः ||१८-६८||
EnglishTranslation: 18.68 He who with supreme devotion to Me will teach this supreme secret to My devotees, shall doubtlessly come to Me.

Sloka: न च तस्मान्मनुष्येषु कश्चिन्मे प्रियकृत्तमः | भविता न च मे तस्मादन्यः प्रियतरो भुवि ||१८-६९||
EnglishTranslation: 18.69 Nor is there any among men who does dearer service to Me, nor shall there be another on earth dearer to Me than he.

Sloka: अध्येष्यते च य इमं धर्म्यं संवादमावयोः | ज्ञानयज्ञेन तेनाहमिष्टः स्यामिति मे मतिः ||१८-७०||
EnglishTranslation: 18.70 And he who will study this sacred dialogue of ours, by him I shall have been worshipped by the sacrifice of wisdom, such is My conviction.

Sloka: श्रद्धावाननसूयश्च शृणुयादपि यो नरः | सोऽपि मुक्तः शुभाँल्लोकान्प्राप्नुयात्पुण्यकर्मणाम् ||१८-७१||
EnglishTranslation: 18.71 Also the man who hears this, full of faith and free from malice, he, too, liberated, shall attain to the happy worlds of those of righteous deeds.

Sloka: कच्चिदेतच्छ्रुतं पार्थ त्वयैकाग्रेण चेतसा | कच्चिदज्ञानसम्मोहः प्रनष्टस्ते धनञ्जय ||१८-७२||
EnglishTranslation: 18.72 Has this been heard, O Arjuna, with one-pointed mind? Has the delusion of thy ignorance been destroyed, O Dhananjaya?

Sloka: अर्जुन उवाच | नष्टो मोहः स्मृतिर्लब्धा त्वत्प्रसादान्मयाच्युत | स्थितोऽस्मि गतसन्देहः करिष्ये वचनं तव ||१८-७३||
EnglishTranslation: 18.73 Arjuna said Destroyed is my delusion as I have gained my knowledge (memory) through Thy grace, O Krishna. I remain freed from doubts. I will act according to Thy word.

Sloka: सञ्जय उवाच | इत्यहं वासुदेवस्य पार्थस्य च महात्मनः | संवादमिममश्रौषमद्भुतं रोमहर्षणम् ||१८-७४||
EnglishTranslation: 18.74 Sanjaya said Thus I have heard this wonderful dialogue between Krishna and the high-souled Arjuna, which causes the hair to stand on end.

Sloka: व्यासप्रसादाच्छ्रुतवानेतद्गुह्यमहं परम् | योगं योगेश्वरात्कृष्णात्साक्षात्कथयतः स्वयम् ||१८-७५||
EnglishTranslation: 18.75 Through the grace of Vyasa I have heard this supreme and most secret Yoga direct from Krishna, the Lord of Yoga, Himself declaring it.

Sloka: राजन्संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य संवादमिममद्भुतम् | केशवार्जुनयोः पुण्यं हृष्यामि च मुहुर्मुहुः ||१८-७६||
EnglishTranslation: 18.76 O King, remembering this wonderful and holy dialogue between Krishna and Arjuna, I rejoice again and again.

Sloka: तच्च संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य रूपमत्यद्भुतं हरेः | विस्मयो मे महान् राजन्हृष्यामि च पुनः पुनः ||१८-७७||
EnglishTranslation: 18.77 And, remembering again and again, also that most wonderful form of Hari, great is my wonder, O King; and I rejoice again and again.

Sloka: यत्र योगेश्वरः कृष्णो यत्र पार्थो धनुर्धरः | तत्र श्रीर्विजयो भूतिर्ध्रुवा नीतिर्मतिर्मम ||१८-७८||
EnglishTranslation: 18.78 Wherever is Krishna, the Lord of Yoga; wherever is Arjuna, the wielder of the bow; there are prosperity, victory, happiness and firm policy; such is my conviction.

Sloka: यस्मात् त्रस्यन्ति भूतानि मृगव्याधान्मृगा इव। सागरान्तामपि महीं लब्ध्वा स परिहीयते ॥
EnglishTranslation: Because the beings are frightened like deer hunterHaving obtained the earth even at the end of the ocean he is lost

Sloka: एतान्यनिगृहीतानि व्यापादयितुमप्यलम्। अविधेया इवादान्ता हयाः पथि कुसारथिम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: It is also possible to torment these others.The horses are not to be found at the end of the scene on the road.

Sloka: यावत्स्वस्थो ह्यय देहः तावन्मृत्युश्च दूरतः। तावदात्महितं कुर्यात् प्रणान्ते किं करिष्यति॥
EnglishTranslation: As long as the body is healthy and death is far away.So then what will he do for his own welfare at the end of his life?

Sloka: ईश्वरस्य स्मरणं प्रभाते उत्थाय अवश्यं कर्तंव्यम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: Remembering the Lord in the morning, one must rise and do it.

Sloka: लोकयात्रा भयं लज्जा दाक्षिण्यं त्यागशीलता। पञ्च यत्र न विद्यन्ते न कुर्यात्तत्र संगतिम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: The journey of the world, fear, shame, generosity, renunciation.Where there are no five, one should not associate with them.

Sloka: सा भार्या या सुचिदक्षा सा भार्या या पतिव्रता। सा भार्या या पतिप्रीता सा भार्या सत्यवादिनी ॥
EnglishTranslation: The wife who is well-eyes is the wife who is faithful to her husband.The wife who is pleased with her husband is the wife who speaks the truth

Sloka: सहायबन्धना ह्यर्थाः सहायाश्चर्थबन्धनाः। अन्योऽन्यबन्धनावेतौ विनान्योऽन्यं न सिध्यतः॥
EnglishTranslation: They are bonds of help and help and are bonds of meaning.Without these two bonds of others, no one else will be accomplished.

Sloka: एकेनापि सुवर्ण पुष्पितेन सुगन्धिता। वसितं तद्वनं सर्वं सुपुत्रेण कुलं यथा॥
EnglishTranslation: It was fragrant with a single golden flowerThe whole forest lived in that forest like a family of a good son

Sloka: उपदेशो हि मूर्खणां प्रकोपाय न शान्तये ॥
EnglishTranslation: The instruction of a fool is not for the sake of anger and not for peace.

Sloka: मित्रं भुड्क्ते संविभज्याश्रितेभ्यो मितं स्वपित्यमितं कर्म कृत्वा । ददात्यमित्रेष्वपि याचितः संस्तमात्मवन्तं प्रजहत्यनर्थाः ॥
EnglishTranslation: He eats a friend and divides himself into the body, and he does not perform his duties as he sleeps.He gives it to his friends and asks for the self-realized and abandons the self-realized.

Sloka: आत्मायत्तौ वृद्धिविनाशौ ॥
EnglishTranslation: The two self-controls are increased and destroyed.

Sloka: विद्यार्थी सेवकः पान्थः क्षुधार्तो भयकातरः। भाण्डारी च प्रतिहारी सप्तसुप्तान् प्रबोधयेत॥
EnglishTranslation: The student, the servant, the path, the hungry, the fearful.The storehouse should awaken the seven sleeping ones.

Sloka: सर्वो हि मन्यते लोक आत्मानं निरूपद्रवम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: Everyone thinks that the world is free from all liquids.

Sloka: न देवो विद्यते काष्ठे न पाषाणे न मृण्मये। भावे हि विद्यते देवस्तस्माद् भावो हि कारणम्॥
EnglishTranslation: There is no god in wood, stone or clay.For in being there is a god; therefore being is the cause.

Sloka: अति रूपेण वै सीता चातिगर्वेण रावणः। अतिदानाद् बलिर्बद्धो ह्यति सर्वत्र वर्जयेत्॥
EnglishTranslation: Sita was very beautiful and Ravana was very proudBali is bound by excessive gifts and should be avoided everywhere.

Sloka: यदभावि न तदभावी भावि चेन्न तदन्यथा ॥
EnglishTranslation: If it is not in the future, it is not the future, but it is not otherwise.

Sloka: ज्ञात्वापि दोषमेव करोति लोकः ॥
EnglishTranslation: Even though he knows it, the world does a fault.

Sloka: हस्ती त्वंकुशमात्रेण बाजो हस्तेन तापते। शृङ्गीलकुटहस्तेन खड्गहस्तेन दुर्जनः॥
EnglishTranslation: The elephant burns with the hand of the elephant by the mere cuckoo.The wicked man with his horns in his hand with a sword in his hand

Sloka: शान्तितुल्यं तपो नास्ति न सन्तोषात्परं सुखम्। न तृष्णया परो व्याधिर्न च धर्मो दयापरः॥
EnglishTranslation: There is no austerity equal to peace, nor happiness greater than satisfaction.There is no disease other than thirst nor righteousness nor is there any other than mercy.

Sloka: अनुसूयुः कृतप्रज्ञः शोभनान्याचरन् सदा। नकृच्छं महदाप्नोति सर्वत्र च विरोचते ॥
EnglishTranslation: They were always envious of the wise and always practiced beautifully.He does not suffer greatly and is always shining everywhere.

Sloka: उद्यमे नावसीदति ॥
EnglishTranslation: It does not despair in the enterprise.

Sloka: संसारयति कृत्यानि सर्वत्र विचिकित्सते। चिरं करोति क्षिप्रार्थे स मूढो भरतर्षभ ॥
EnglishTranslation: The worldly things are treated everywhere.O best of the Bharatas that foolish man is doing a long time for a long time

Sloka: हस्तस्य भूषणं दानम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: The ornament of the hand is the gift.

Sloka: मौनं सर्वार्थसाधनम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: Silence is the means of all purposes.

Sloka: त्यज दुर्जनसंसर्गं भज साधुसमागमम् । कुरु पुण्यमहोरात्रं स्मर नित्यमनित्यतः॥
EnglishTranslation: Give up the association of the wicked and worship the saintly ones.Do pious day and night remember ever and eternally.

Sloka: मृदुर्हि परिभूयते ॥
EnglishTranslation: The soft is humiliated.

Sloka: अमित्रं कुरुते मित्रं मित्रं द्वेष्टि हिनस्ति च । कर्म चारभते दुष्टं तमाहुर्मूढचेतसम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: He makes an enemy a friend and hates a friend and kills him.A person who practices evil deeds is called a foolish person.

Sloka: जन्ममृत्युर्नियत्येको भुनक्तयेकः शुभाशुभम्। नरकेषु पतत्येकः एको याति परां गतिम्॥
EnglishTranslation: Birth and death are certain, one is the one who eats, one is good and evil.One falls into hell alone and one attains the supreme destination.

Sloka: यद् दूरं यद् दुराराध्यं यच्च दूरे व्यवस्थितम् । तत्सर्वं तपसा साध्यं तपो हि दुरतिक्रमम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: Whatever is far away, whatever is difficult to worship, and whatever is situated far away.All that is achieved by austerities is difficult to transgress.

Sloka: अर्थेषणा न व्यसनेषु गण्यते ॥
EnglishTranslation: The desire for meaning is not counted in addictions.

Sloka: विनयाद् याति पात्रताम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: By humility, he becomes deserving.

Sloka: यज्ञो दानमध्ययनं तपश्च चत्वार्येतान्यन्वेतानि सणि। दमः सत्यमार्जवमानृशंस्यं चत्वार्येतान्यनुयान्ति सन्तः ॥
EnglishTranslation: Sacrifice, charity, study and austerity are these four.The saintly persons follow the fourfold path of self-control, truthfulness, uprightness and compassion.

Sloka: भाग्यं फ़लति सर्वत्र न विद्या न च पौरुषम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: Fortunateness is everywhere, neither knowledge nor manliness.

Sloka: वरयेत्कुलजां प्राज्ञो निरूपामपि कन्यकाम्। रूपवतीं न नीचस्य विवाहः सदृशे कुले ॥
EnglishTranslation: A wise man should choose a daughter born of a familyA beautiful woman is not married to a lowly person in a similar family

Sloka: अनुशासनेन एव मनुष्यः महान् भवति ॥
EnglishTranslation: It is by discipline that a man becomes great.

Sloka: ययोश्चित्तेन वा चित्तं निभृतं निभृतेन वा। समेति प्रज्ञया प्रज्ञा तयोमैत्री न जीवर्यति ॥
EnglishTranslation: By the mind of which the mind is calm or by the calm.By intelligence, intelligence, intelligence, and friendship, do not live.

Sloka: न नित्यं लभते दुःखं न नित्यं लभते सुखम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: He does not always suffer suffering nor does he always attain happiness.

Sloka: अधना धनमिच्छन्ति वाचं चैव चतुष्पदाः। मानवाः स्वर्गमिच्छन्ति मोक्षमिच्छन्ति देवताः॥
EnglishTranslation: The poor desire wealth and the four-legged words.Men desire heaven, the gods desire liberation.

Sloka: आत्मापराधवृक्षस्य फलान्येतानि देहिनाम् । दारिद्रयरोग दुःखानि बन्धनव्यसनानि च॥
EnglishTranslation: These are the fruits of the embodied tree of the tree of self-officiency.Poverty, diseases, pains, bondage and addiction.

Sloka: प्रत्युत्थानं च युद्धं च संविभागश्च बन्धुषु। स्वयमाक्रम्य भोक्तं च शिक्षेच्चत्वारि कुक्कुटात्॥
EnglishTranslation: Returning and fighting and distribution among relativesHe should invading himself and eat the food from the four chickens.

Sloka: बुद्धयो भयं प्रणुदति तपसा विन्दते महत्। गुरुशुश्रूषया ज्ञानं शान्तिं योगेन विन्दति ॥
EnglishTranslation: The intellects are afraid of fear and attains great austerities.By serving the spiritual master, one attains knowledge, peace and yoga.

Sloka: महते योऽपकाराय नरस्य प्रभवेत्ररः। तेन वैरं समासज्य दूरस्थोऽमीति नाश्चसेत् ॥
EnglishTranslation: A man who is a great man who is a great man for the sake of harm.Therefore, one should not be able to fight the enemy, saying, “I am in a distance.”

Sloka: समवेक्ष्येह धर्माथौं सम्भारान् योऽधिगच्छति। स वै सम्भृतसम्भारः सततं सुखमेधते ॥
EnglishTranslation: Translation Error

Sloka: गुणो भूषयते रूपं शीलं भूषयते कुलम्। सिद्धिर्भूषयते विद्यां भोगो भूषयते धनम्॥
EnglishTranslation: The virtue adorns the form, character, adorns the family.Siddhi adorns knowledge and enjoyment adorns wealth.

Sloka: वरं मौनं कार्यं न च वचनमुक्तं यदनृतम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: It is better to silence nor should it be said that the words are false

Sloka: को हि भारः समर्थानां किं दूर व्यवसायिनाम्। को विदेश सुविद्यानां को परः प्रियवादिनम्॥
EnglishTranslation: Who is the burden of those who are able to do so far awayWho is the foreign to the well-educated and who is the other who speaks pleasantly?

Sloka: एकाकिना तपो द्वाभ्यां पठनं गायनं त्रिभिः। चतुर्भिगमन क्षेत्रं पञ्चभिर्बहुभि रणम्॥
EnglishTranslation: Reading and singing with two one austerities alone.The field of the four visitors is a battlefield by five

Sloka: ईर्ष्यी घृणी न संतुष्टः क्रोधनो नित्यशङ्कितः। परभाग्योपजीवी च षडेते नित्यदुःखिताः ॥
EnglishTranslation: He is jealous, hatred, not satisfied, and he is always suspicious of anger.These six are ever grieved for the sake of the fortune of others

Sloka: सत्यभाषणं पुण्यं वर्तते ॥
EnglishTranslation: The truthful speech is pious.

Sloka: दुरनुबध्नं कार्य साधयेत् ॥
EnglishTranslation: One should accomplish the task which is difficult to bind.

Sloka: पंच त्वाऽनुगमिष्यन्ति यत्र यत्र गमिष्यसि । मित्राण्यमित्रा मध्यस्था उपजीव्योपजीविनः ॥
EnglishTranslation: Five will follow you wherever you go.Friends are friends in the middle and subsistence

Sloka: दरिद्रता धीरयता विराजते कुवस्त्रता स्वच्छतया विराजते। कदन्नता चोष्णतया विराजते कुरूपता शीलतया विराजते॥
EnglishTranslation: Poverty is steadfast and bad clothes shines cleanly.It shines in hotness and shining in the form of morality.

Sloka: उद्योगसम्पन्नं समुपैति लक्ष्मीः ॥
EnglishTranslation: The goddess of fortune approaches him who is endowed with industry.

Sloka: यो ध्रुवाणि परित्यज्य ह्यध्रुवं परिसेवते। ध्रुवाणि तस्य नश्यन्ति चाध्रुवं नष्टमेव तत् ॥
EnglishTranslation: He who abandons the poles and serves the impermanent.The poles of the universe are destroyed and the impermanent is destroyed.

Sloka: आक्रु श्मानो नाक्रोशेन्मन्युरेव तितिक्षतः। आक्रोष्टारं निर्दहति सुकृतं चास्य विन्दति॥
EnglishTranslation: Akru shman nakroshenmanyureva tikshato.He burns the screaming and finds his good deeds.

Sloka: निषेवते प्रशस्तानी निन्दितानी न सेवते । अनास्तिकः श्रद्धान एतत् पण्डितलक्षणम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: She serves her praises and does not serve the blameworthy.This is the characteristic of the learned without faith.

Sloka: जरा रुपं हरति हि धैर्यमाशा मृत्युः प्राणान् धर्मचर्यामसूया। क्रोधः श्रियं शिलमनार्यसेवा हृियं कामः सर्वमेवाभिमानः॥
EnglishTranslation: For old age takes away the form of patience, hope, death, life, righteousness, and envy.Anger, prosperity, rock, ignoble service, the heart, desire, all egoism.

Sloka: स्वर्गस्थितानामिह जीवलोके चत्वारि चिह्नानि वसन्ति देहे। दानप्रसङ्गो मधुरा च वाणी देवार्चनं ब्राह्मणतर्पणं च॥
EnglishTranslation: There are four signs in the body of the living beings who are in heaven.The occasion of charity and sweet speech, worship of the gods and satisfying the brahmins.

Sloka: बहूनां चैव सत्तवानां रिपुञ्जयः । वर्षान्धाराधरो मेधस्तृणैरपि निवार्यते॥
EnglishTranslation: He also conquers the enemies of many beings.The sacrifice is prevented by the grass and the grass.

Sloka: कष्टं च खलु मूर्खत्वं कष्ट च खलु यौवनम्। कष्टात्कष्टतरं चैव परगृहेनिवासनम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: And it is difficult to be stupid and it is hard to be youth.It is difficult to live in another’s house.

Sloka: एकमेवाद्वितीयम तद् यद् राजन्नावबुध्यसे। सत्यम स्वर्गस्य सोपानम् पारवारस्य नैरिव ॥
EnglishTranslation: There is only one and the same, O king, that you do not understand.It is true that the stairs of heaven is like a crossing of a paravara.

Sloka: सहायः समसुखदुःखः ॥
EnglishTranslation: Help is equal pleasure and pain.

Sloka: विद्वान् प्रशस्यते लोके विद्वान् सर्वत्र गौरवम्। विद्वया लभते सर्वं विद्या सर्वत्र पूज्यते॥
EnglishTranslation: A learned man is praised in the world and a learned man is honored everywhere.By knowledge he attains all knowledge and is worshiped everywhere.

Sloka: जलबिन्दुनिपातेन क्रमशः पूर्यते घटः। स हेतु सर्वविद्यानां धर्मस्य च धनस्य च॥
EnglishTranslation: The pot is gradually filled by the drop of water drops.He is the cause of all knowledge and righteousness and wealth

Sloka: उपसर्गेऽन्यच्रके च दुर्भिक्षे च भयावहे। असाधुजनसम्पर्के पलायति स जीवति॥
EnglishTranslation: In the prefix and in another character, in the famine, in fear.He who runs away from the unrighteous people is alive

Sloka: नैव पश्यति जन्मान्धः कामान्धो नैव पश्यति। मदोन्मत्ता न पश्यन्ति अर्थी दोषं न पश्यति॥
EnglishTranslation: The blind man who is born blind does not see the blind man of lust.The drunken, the drunken, do not see the evil, but the seeker does not see the fault.

Sloka: यस्मिन् देशे न सम्मानो न वृत्तिर्न च बान्धवाः। न च विद्यागमोऽप्यस्ति वासस्तत्र न कारयेत् ॥
EnglishTranslation: In a country where there is no respect, no profession, no relatives.There is no acquisition of knowledge, and one should not make a dress there.

Sloka: चिकीर्षितं विप्रकृतं च यस्य नान्ये जनाः कर्म जानन्ति किञ्चित् । मन्त्रे गुप्ते सम्यगनुष्ठिते च नाल्पोऽप्यस्य च्यवते कश्चिदर्थः ॥
EnglishTranslation: No one else knows anything else that has been done and distracted.There is no meaning in the mantra, even if the mantra is kept in a secret manner, and when it is properly performed.

Sloka: दाने तपसि शौर्ये च विज्ञाने विनये नये । विस्मयो न हि कर्तव्यो बहुरत्ना वसुन्धरा॥
EnglishTranslation: In charity, austerity, valour, knowledge, humility and newness.The earth should not be astonished to be abundantly precious

Sloka: प्रस्तावसदृशं वाक्यं प्रभावसदृशं प्रियम् । आत्मशक्तिसमं कोपं यो जानाति स पण्डितः॥
EnglishTranslation: A statement like a proposal is dear to the influenceHe who knows anger equal to his own power is a wise man.

Sloka: मित्रसंग्रहेण बलं सम्पद्यते ॥
EnglishTranslation: The collection of friends is attained by strength.

Sloka: न सुखाल्लभ्यते सुखम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: Happiness is not obtained by happiness.

Sloka: एतदर्थ कुलीनानां नृपाः कुर्वन्ति संग्रहम्। आदिमध्यावसानेषु न त्यजन्ति च ते नृपम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: For this purpose the kings of the nobles collect.They do not abandon the king in the beginning, middle and end of the body.

Sloka: वृध्दा न ते ये न वदन्ति धर्मम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: Those who do not speak of religion are not old.

Sloka: यदतप्तं प्रणमति न तत् सन्तापयन्त्यपि। यश्च स्वयं नतं दारुं न तत् सत्रमयन्त्यपि ॥
EnglishTranslation: They do not torment what he is burning even when he is burning.And he who himself bows down to the wood, even if he does not offer it to the satra.

Sloka: यः कार्यं न पश्यति सोऽन्धः ॥
EnglishTranslation: He who does not see the work is blind.

Sloka: चत्वारि राज्ञा तु महाबलेना वर्ज्यान्याहु: पण्डितस्तानि विद्यात् । अल्पप्रज्ञै: सह मन्त्रं न कुर्यात दीर्घसुत्रै रभसैश्चारणैश्च ॥
EnglishTranslation: The king should be avoided by the king with great strength and should be known as the learned.One should not chant the mantra with low intelligence, long sons, rabhasas and rangers.

Sloka: सुखस्य मूलं धर्मः ॥
EnglishTranslation: The root of happiness is religion.

Sloka: अष्टौ गुणाः पुरुषं दीपयन्ति प्रज्ञा च कौल्यं च दमः श्रुतं च। पराक्रमश्चाबहुभाषिता च दानं यथाशक्ति कृतज्ञता च ॥
EnglishTranslation: The eight qualities illuminate a man, wisdom, courage, self-control and hearing.He was prowess and had many words and charity and gratitude as much as he could.

Sloka: आलस्योपहता विद्या परहस्तं गतं धनम्। अल्पबीजहतं क्षेत्रं हतं सैन्यमनायकम्॥
EnglishTranslation: The knowledge of the other is the wealth that has been lost by laziness.The field was killed by little seeds and the army was killed and the hero was killed.

Sloka: जिता सभा वस्त्रवता मिष्टाशा गोमता जिता। अध्वा जितो यानवता सर्वं शीलवता जितम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: The assembly winners, dressed in clothes, won the sweetness of the cow.He conquered the chariot and conquered everything by his character.

Sloka: ते पुत्रा ये पितुर्भक्ताः ॥
EnglishTranslation: Those sons who were devoted to their father

Sloka: दूरस्थोऽपि न दूरस्थो यो यस्य मनसि स्थितः । यो यस्य हृदये नास्ति समीपस्थोऽपि दूरतः॥
EnglishTranslation: Even if he is far away, he is not far away from anyone whose mind is in his mind.Whoever is not in his heart even in the presence of a nearby

Sloka: षडेव तु गुणाः पुंसा न हातव्याः कदाचन। सत्यं दानमनालस्यमनसूया क्षमा धृतिः ॥
EnglishTranslation: The six qualities should never be lost by a man.Truth, charity, laziness, envy, forgiveness, patience.

Sloka: बलवान हीनेन विग्रहणीयात् ॥
EnglishTranslation: It should be dissolved by a strong deficiency.

Sloka: सत्येन रक्ष्यते धर्मो विद्या योगेन रक्ष्यते । मृजया रक्ष्यते रुपं कुलं वृत्तेन रक्ष्यते ॥
EnglishTranslation: Truth protects religion, knowledge is protected by yoga.The form is protected by the widow and the family is protected by the circle.

Sloka: अजीर्णे भेषजं वारि जीर्णे तद् बलप्रदम्। भोजने चामृतं वारि भोजनान्तें विषप्रदम्॥
EnglishTranslation: It is strong in digestion in digestion when indigestion is indigestionIt is poisonous in food and water is poisonous at the end of the food

Sloka: सदाचारः सर्वेषां धर्माणां श्रेष्ठः अस्ति ॥
EnglishTranslation: The virtuous conduct is the best of all religions.

Sloka: विद्वान सर्वत्र पूज्यते ॥
EnglishTranslation: A learned person is worshiped everywhere.

Sloka: दुःखादुद्विजते जन्तुः सुखं सर्वाय रुच्यते ॥
EnglishTranslation: A living being is afraid of pain and is like a thing that is pleasing to everyone.

Sloka: प्रसादो निष्फलो यस्य क्रोधश्चापि निरर्थकः। न तं भर्तारमिच्छनित षण्ढं पतिमिव स्त्रियः ॥
EnglishTranslation: His grace is fruitless and his anger is useless.Just as a woman does not wish to have a husband for her husband.

Sloka: समाने शोभते प्रीती राज्ञि सेवा च शोभते। वाणिज्यं व्यवहारेषु स्त्री दिव्या शोभते गृहे ॥
EnglishTranslation: The lover is equally beautiful and the service of the queen is beautiful.A woman is beautiful in her house in commercial behavior.

Sloka: हेतुरत्र भविष्यति ॥
EnglishTranslation: The reason will be here.

Sloka: पर्जन्यनाथाः पशवो राजानो मन्त्रिबान्धवाः । पतयो बान्धवाः स्त्रीणां ब्राह्मणा वेदबान्धवाः ॥
EnglishTranslation: The lords of the rains were the animals, kings, ministers and relatives.The husbands are relatives of women, and the brāhmaṇas are the relatives of the Vedas.

Sloka: यस्मै देवाः प्रयच्छन्ति पुरुषाय प्रराभवम्। बुद्धिं तस्यापकर्षन्ति सोऽवाचीनानि पश्यति ॥
EnglishTranslation: To whom the gods give to the man I have been born.They pull his intelligence and he sees the unfavorable things.

Sloka: दानं होमं दैवतं मङ्गलानि प्रायश्चित्तान् विविधान् लोकवादान् । एतानि यः कुरुत नैत्यकानि तस्योत्थानं देवता राधयन्ति ॥
EnglishTranslation: Charity, sacrifice, deity, auspiciousness, atonement and various kinds of popular arguments.The demigods worship the Lord who performs these rituals daily.

Sloka: न विश्वसेत्कुमित्रे च मित्रे चापि न विश्वसेत्। कदाचित्कुपितं मित्रं सर्वं गुह्यं प्रकाशयेत् ॥
EnglishTranslation: He should not trust a bad friend nor should he trust a friend.Sometimes a angry friend should reveal all the secrets.

Sloka: दुःखेनासाद्यते पात्रम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: The vessel is achieved by suffering.

Sloka: अलब्धलाभो नालसस्य ॥
EnglishTranslation: The laziness of the laziness is not obtained.

Sloka: अस्माभिः सदा चरित्रं रक्षणीयम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: We should always protect your character.

Sloka: परं क्षिपति दोषेण वर्त्तमानः स्वयं तथा । यश्च क्रुध्यत्यनीशानः स च मूढतमो नरः ॥
EnglishTranslation: He throws it away, and he’s just doing it with a fault.And he who is angry with the Lord is the most foolish.

Sloka: उपार्जितानां वित्तानां त्याग एव हि रक्षणम्। तडागोदरसंस्थानां परिदाह इदाम्मससाम्॥
EnglishTranslation: It is the renunciation of the earned wealth.The ponds and the abdomen of the Idammasas are burnt.

Sloka: पुस्तकेषु च या विद्या परहस्तेषु च यद्धनम् । उत्पन्नेषु च कार्येषु न सा विद्या न तद्धनम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: The knowledge in the books and the wealth in the hands of others.There is no knowledge in the works that have arisen and that is not wealth.

Sloka: अनर्थाः संघचारिणः ॥
EnglishTranslation: They are miserable and confused.

Sloka: असन्त्यागात् पापकृतामपापांस्तुल्यो दण्डः स्पृशते मिश्रभावात्। शुष्केणार्दंदह्यते मिश्रभावात्तस्मात् पापैः सह सन्धि नकुर्य्यात् ॥
EnglishTranslation: The punishment of the sin committed by sin by non-renunciation touches the mixture of the mixture.It is burnt with dryness, and therefore one should not make a treaty with the sinful.

Sloka: श्रध्दा ज्ञानं ददाति, नम्रता मानं ददाति, योग्यता स्थानं ददाति ॥
EnglishTranslation: The faithful gives knowledge, humility, honor, and qualifications give a place.

Sloka: विज्ञान दीपेन संसार भयं निवर्तते ॥
EnglishTranslation: By the lamp of knowledge, the fear of the world is relieved.

Sloka: लोभमूलानि पापानि ॥
EnglishTranslation: They are the roots of greed.

Sloka: क्षिप्रं विजानाति चिरं शृणोति विज्ञाय चार्थ भते न कामात्। नासम्पृष्टो व्युपयुङ्क्ते परार्थे तत् प्रज्ञानं प्रथमं पण्डितस्य ॥
EnglishTranslation: He quickly knows and hears it for a long time and knows it and does not desire for wealth, not from lust.When a person is not touched by a learned person, he is the first person to understand the purpose of others’ for the sake of others.

Sloka: इन्द्रियैरिन्द्रियार्थेषु वर्तमानैरनिग्रहैः। तैरयं ताप्यते लोको नक्षत्राणि ग्रहैरिव ॥
EnglishTranslation: By the senses, the objects of the senses and the uncontrolled.The world is tormented by these, just as the stars are in the planets.

Sloka: स्वभावो दुरतिक्रमः ॥
EnglishTranslation: Nature is difficult to transgress.

Sloka: आचारः कुलमाख्याति देशमाख्याति भाषणम्। सम्भ्रमः स्नेहमाख्याति वपुराख्याति भोजनम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: Conduct tells the family, tells the country, speech.Confusion, affection, describes the body, and the food is described.

Sloka: अप्रयत्नात् कार्यविपत्तिभर्वती ॥
EnglishTranslation: She is not trying to do so without effort.

Sloka: रूपयौवनसम्पन्ना विशालकुलसम्भवाः। विद्याहीना न शोभन्ते निर्गन्धा इव किंशुकाः ॥
EnglishTranslation: They were endowed with beauty and youth and were born of large families.Without knowledge they do not look beautiful like fragrances without fragrance

Sloka: वृथा वृष्टिः समुद्रेषु वृथा तृप्तेषु भोजनम्। वृथा दानं धनाढ्येषु वृथा दीपो दिवापि च॥
EnglishTranslation: In vain rain is in the seas and food is in vain.Charity is in vain in wealth and in vain a lamp is in vain

Sloka: स्त्रीषु राजसु सर्पेषु स्वाध्यायप्रभुशत्रुषु। भोगेष्वायुषि विश्चासं कः प्राज्ञः कर्तुर्महति ॥
EnglishTranslation: Among women, kings, snakes, their study of the masters of their own study.Who is wise in the pleasures of life and who is the greatest of the doers?

Sloka: अपरीक्ष्यकारिणं श्रीः परित्यजति ॥
EnglishTranslation: The goddess of fortune gives up the unexamined.

Sloka: क्रोधो वैवस्वतो राजा तृष्णा वैतरणी नदी। विद्या कामदुधा धेनुः संतोषो नन्दनं वनम्॥
EnglishTranslation: Anger is the king of Vaivasvata, thirst and Vaitarani.Knowledge is the milk of desire and the cow is content and the forest of Nandana.

Sloka: मर्माण्यस्थीनि ह्रदयं तथासून् ,रुक्षा वाचो निर्दहन्तीह पुंसाम्। तस्माद् वाचुमुषतीमुग्ररुपां धर्मारामो नित्यशो वर्जयीत॥
EnglishTranslation: The hearts of the marrow and the bones of the marrows are burnt by men here.Therefore one should avoid the fierce form of Vachumushati and should avoid the Dharma.

Sloka: पृथिव्यां त्रीणी रत्नानि अन्नमापः सुभाषितम् । मूढैः पाषाणखण्डेषु रत्नसंज्ञा विधीयते ॥
EnglishTranslation: There are three gems on earth, food, water, good proverbs.Fools are prescribed in the pieces of stones and are called ratna.

Sloka: कांश्चिदर्थात्ररः प्राज्ञो लघुमूलान्महाफलान्। क्षिप्रमारभते कर्तुं न विघ्नयति तादृशान् ॥
EnglishTranslation: The wise man of some meanings are greatly fruitful from the small roots.He quickly begins to do such things and does not interfere with such things.

Sloka: रथः शरीरं पुरुषस्य राजत्रात्मा नियन्तेन्द्रियाण्यस्य चाश्चाः। तैरप्रमत्तः कुशली सदश्वैर्दान्तैः सुखं याति रथीव धीरः ॥
EnglishTranslation: The chariot is the body of the man, the king is the self, and the senses are the controller of the senses.They are not careless and well with their good horses and with their teeth like a steadfast charioteer

Sloka: अन्तर्गतमलो दुष्टस्तीर्थस्नानशतैरपि। न शुद्धयतियथाभाण्डं सुरया दाहितं च तत्॥
EnglishTranslation: Inside the impure evil is even hundreds of baths.It does not purify the vessels as a vessel burned by wine

Sloka: अभ्यावहति कल्याणं विविधं वाक् सुभाषिता ॥
EnglishTranslation: The good speech of speech is the source of all good fortune.

Sloka: एको धर्म: परम श्रेय: क्षमैका शान्तिरुक्तमा। विद्वैका परमा तृप्तिरहिंसैका सुखावहा ॥
EnglishTranslation: One religion is the supreme good: forgiveness is one peacefulness.Vidvaika is the supreme satisfaction and the one is the one who brings happiness.

Sloka: पात्रत्वाद् धनमाप्नोति ॥
EnglishTranslation: He gets wealth because he is worthy.

Sloka: बहूनामप्यसाराणां समवायो हि दुर्जयः ॥
EnglishTranslation: It is invincible that the combination of many essences is invincible

Sloka: विद्या परमं बलम ॥
EnglishTranslation: Vidya is the supreme strength.

Sloka: पन्चाग्न्यो मनुष्येण परिचर्या: प्रयत्नत:। पिता माताग्निरात्मा च गुरुश्च भरतर्षभ ॥
EnglishTranslation: The five fires should be attended by a man with great effort.O best of the Bharatas, the father, mother, fire, self and spiritual master

Sloka: कुलं शीलेन रक्ष्यते ॥
EnglishTranslation: The family is protected by virtue.

Sloka: अतितृष्णा न कर्तव्या, तृष्णां नैव परित्यजेत् ॥
EnglishTranslation: One should not be excessively thirsty, nor should one give up thirst.

Sloka: द्वाविमौ पुरुषौ राजन स्वर्गस्योपरि तिष्ठत: । प्रभुश्च क्षमया युक्तो दरिद्रश्च प्रदानवान् ॥
EnglishTranslation: O King, these two men, O King, remain upon the heavenly planets.He was endowed with forgiveness and gave him a poor man

Sloka: पण्डितोऽपि वरं शत्रुर्न मूर्खो हितकारकः ॥
EnglishTranslation: Even a learned man is better than an enemy and is not a fool who is beneficial

Sloka: न वै भित्रा जातु चरन्ति धर्मं न वै सुखं प्राप्नुवन्तीह भित्राः। न वै सुखंभित्रा गौरवंप्राप्नुवन्ति न वै भित्राप्रशमंरोचयन्ति ॥
EnglishTranslation: They never practice righteousness nor do they attain happiness here.They do not attain to dignity, nor do they relief from their fears.

Sloka: कामं क्रोधं तथा लोभं स्वाद शृङ्गारकौतुकम्। अतिनिद्राऽतिसेवा च विद्यार्थी ह्याष्ट वर्जयेत्॥
EnglishTranslation: Lust, anger, greed, taste, aesthetics and festivities.A student should avoid excessive sleep and excessive service.

Sloka: गतं शोको न कर्तव्यं भविष्यं नैव चिन्तयेत्। वर्तमानेन कालेन प्रवर्तन्ते विचक्षणाः॥
EnglishTranslation: One should not grieve for the past nor think of the future.The wise are engaged in the present time.

Sloka: यशोधनानां हि यशो गरीयः ॥
EnglishTranslation: The fame of the Yaśodhanas is the greatest.

Sloka: नास्ति मेघसमं तोयं नास्ति चात्मसमं बलम्। नास्ति चक्षुसमं तेजो नास्ति चान्नसमं प्रियम्॥
EnglishTranslation: There is no water equal to a cloud and no strength equal to self.There is no effulgence equal to the eye, nor is there any dear equal to food.

Sloka: ईप्सितं मनसः सर्वं कस्य सम्पद्यते सुखम्। दैवायत्तं यतः सर्वं तस्मात् सन्तोषमाश्रयेत्॥
EnglishTranslation: Whose happiness is attained by all the desired minds?Since everything is given to fate, one should take refuge in satisfaction.

Sloka: षडिमान् पुरुषो जह्यात् भिन्नं नावमिवार्णवे अप्रवक्तारं आचार्यं अनध्यायिनम् ऋत्विजम् । आरक्षितारं राजानं भार्यां चाऽप्रियवादिनीं ग्रामकामं च गोपालं वनकामं च नापितम्॥
EnglishTranslation: A man who is not studied in the ocean is like a boat in a boat, and a priest is not a studied priest.The king was protecting his wife who was unpleasant to the cowherd man and the cowherd man and the cowherd men who had desired the forest

Sloka: उपायपूर्वं न दुष्करं स्यात् ॥
EnglishTranslation: It would not be difficult to do before the means.

Sloka: वृत्तं यत्नेन संरक्षेद् वित्तमेति च याति च। अक्षीणो वित्ततः क्षीणो वृत्ततस्तु हतो हतः ॥
EnglishTranslation: He should preserve the circumstances and go to the wealth.He was not exhausted from wealth and was depleted of his conduct and was killed by his conduct.

Sloka: अपुत्रता मनुष्याणां श्रेयसे न कुपुत्रता ॥
EnglishTranslation: Without sons, human beings are not a bad son.

Sloka: धर्मस्य मूलमर्थः ॥
EnglishTranslation: The root of religion is the meaning.

Sloka: नास्ति बुद्धिमतां शत्रुः ॥
EnglishTranslation: There is no enemy for the wise.

Sloka: उपायेन हि यच्छक्यं न तच्छक्यं पराक्रमैः ॥
EnglishTranslation: Whatever is impossible by means is not possible by prowess.

Sloka: चराति चरतो भगः ॥
EnglishTranslation: Charati Charato Bhaga.

Sloka: अहिं नृपं च शार्दूलं वराटं बालकं तथा। परश्वानं च मूर्खं च सप्तसुप्तान् बोधयेत्॥
EnglishTranslation: The serpent, the king, the tiger, the boy and the child.One should awaken the other horse and the fool who are seven asleep.

Sloka: मानेन रक्ष्यते धान्यमश्चान् रक्षत्यनुक्रमः । अभीक्ष्णदर्शनं ग्राश्च स्त्रियो रक्ष्याः कुचैलतः ॥
EnglishTranslation: The sequence protects the grain and the grain.The women should be protected from the breasts of the grave.

Sloka: शुनः पुच्छमिव व्यर्थं जीवितं विद्यया विना। न गुह्यगोपने शक्तं न च दंशनिवारणे॥
EnglishTranslation: Like a dog's tail, life is useless without knowledge.It is not capable of concealing secrets nor in the prevention of bites

Sloka: कोकिलानां स्वरो रूपं नारी रूपं पतिव्रतम्। विद्या रूपं कुरूपाणां क्षमा रूपं तपस्विनाम्॥
EnglishTranslation: The voice of the cuckoos is the form of a woman and the form of a husband.Knowledge is the form of the ugly form of the form of the ascetics.

Sloka: वनस्पतेरपक्वानि फलानि प्रचिनोति यः । स नाप्नोति रसं तेभ्यो बीजं चास्य विनश्यति ॥
EnglishTranslation: He who chooses the ripe fruits of a plant.He does not obtain the taste of the taste and the seeds of these are destroyed.

Sloka: संहतिः कार्यसाधिका ॥
EnglishTranslation: Samhatiḥ karyasadhikā.

Sloka: निश्चित्वा यः प्रक्रमते नान्तर्वसति कर्मणः । अवन्ध्यकालो वश्यात्मा स वै पण्डित उच्यते ॥
EnglishTranslation: He who decides and proceeds to live inside and does not reside.The self-control is called a learned person who is under the control of the self.

Sloka: निर्गुणस्य हतं रूपं दुःशीलस्य हतं कुलम्। असिद्धस्य हता विद्या अभोगस्य हतं धनम्॥
EnglishTranslation: The form of the devoid of virtue is the destruction of the evil character of the wicked.The knowledge of the incomplete is the loss of enjoyment of non-enjoyment.

Sloka: न ह्राविज्ञातशीलस्य प्रदातव्यः प्रतिश्रयः ॥
EnglishTranslation: The reliance on the decline of the unknown should not be given.

Sloka: एकः सम्पत्रमश्नाति वस्त्रे वासश्च शोभनम् । योऽसंविभज्य भृत्येभ्यः को नृशंसतरस्ततः ॥
EnglishTranslation: One eats a mixture of clothing and dress in clothes.Who is more cruel than a man who does not divide his servants?

Sloka: चला लक्ष्मीश्चलाः प्राणाश्चले जीवितमन्दिरे। चलाचले च संसारे धर्म एको हि निश्चलः॥
EnglishTranslation: Chala Lakshmi is moving in the life of the moving life.And in this world of moving and unmoving righteousness alone is motionless

Sloka: प्रियो भवति दानेन प्रियवादेन चापरः। मन्त्रमूलबलेनान्यो यः प्रियः प्रिय एव सः ॥
EnglishTranslation: He is dear to charity and another by pleasant arguments.He who is dear to the root of the mantra is dear to him.

Sloka: षण्णामात्मनि नित्यानामैश्वर्यं योऽधिगच्छति। न स पापैः कुतोऽनथैर्युज्यते विजितेन्द्रियः ॥
EnglishTranslation: He who attains the opulence of the six eternal Self.He is not able to control his senses and has conquered his senses

Sloka: ते पुत्रा ये पितुर्भक्ताः सः पिता यस्तु पोषकः। तन्मित्रं यत्र विश्वासः सा भार्या या निवृतिः ॥
EnglishTranslation: Those sons who are devoted to the father are the father who is the nourisher.That is the friend where trust is the wife who is withdrawn

Sloka: यत् सुखं सेवमानोपि धर्मार्थाभ्यां न हीयते। कामं तदुपसेवेत न मूढव्रतमाचरेत्। ॥
EnglishTranslation: That which is not deprived of both dharma and artha, even while serving happiness.One should serve that desire and should not observe a foolish vow.॥

Sloka: विद्या धनेषु उत्तमा वर्त्तते ॥
EnglishTranslation: Knowledge is the best in wealth.

Sloka: सत्यमेव जयते ॥
EnglishTranslation: Truth is the victory.

Sloka: विद्यामदो धनमदस्तृतीयोऽभिजनो मदः । मदा एतेऽवलिप्तानामेत एव सतां दमाः ॥
EnglishTranslation: The third is the knowledge, the madness, the madness, the madness.These are the self-restraints of the virtuous who are smeared with me.

Sloka: अभ्यावहति कल्याणं विविधं वाक् सुभाषिता। सैव दुर्भाषिता राजनर्थायोपपद्यते ॥
EnglishTranslation: A good proverb brings about the various words of goodness.That very thing is difficult to speak for the sake of the king.

Sloka: सन्तापाद् भ्रश्यते रुपं सन्तापाद् भ्रश्यते बलम्। सन्तापाद् भ्रश्यते ज्ञानं सन्तापाद् व्याधिमृच्छति ॥
EnglishTranslation: The form is destroyed by the pain and the strength is destroyed by the pain.Knowledge is destroyed by grief and by suffering one suffers from disease.

Sloka: उपायं चिन्तयेत्प्राज्ञस्तथा पायं च चिन्तयेत् ॥
EnglishTranslation: A wise person should think of a remedy and should think of drinking it.

Sloka: यादृशैः सत्रिविशते यादृशांश्चोपसेवते। यादृगिच्छेच्च भवितुं तादृग् भवति पूरुषः ॥
EnglishTranslation: Whatever he enters into the satri and whatever he serves.The person who wants to become a person is such a person.

Sloka: ये शोकमनुवर्त्तन्ते न तेषां विद्यते सुखम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: Those who follow sorrow do not have happiness.

Sloka: दश धर्मं न जानन्ति धृतराष्ट्र निबोध तान्। मत्तः प्रमत्तः उन्मत्तः श्रान्तः क्रुद्धो बुभुक्षितः ॥ त्वरमाणश्च लुब्धश्च भीतः कामी च ते दश। तस्मादेतेषु सर्वेषु न प्रसज्जेत पण्डितः ॥
EnglishTranslation: Ten Dharma do not know, O Dhritarashtra, listen to them.He was drunk, mad, mad, tired, angry and hungry.They are ten in hurry, greedy, frightened and lustful.Therefore a learned person should not be attached to all these things.

Sloka: न योऽभ्यसुयत्यनुकम्पते च न दुर्बलः प्रातिभाव्यं करोति । नात्याह किञ्चित् क्षमते विवादं सर्वत्र तादृग् लभते प्रशांसाम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: He who is not absorbed and compassionate does not become a weak person.Nothing is exceedingly able to arguice, and everywhere he obtains such adoptions.

Sloka: आलस्यं मदमोहौ चापलं गोष्टिरेव च। स्तब्धता चाभिमानित्वं तथा त्यागित्वमेव च। एते वै सप्त दोषाः स्युः सदा विद्यार्थिनां मताः ॥
EnglishTranslation: Laziness, drunkenness and delusion are agile and goshti.Study and self-control and renunciation.These seven evils are always considered to be the students of the students.

Sloka: अप्युन्मत्तात् प्रलपतो बालाच्च परिजल्पतः। सर्वतः सारमादद्यात् अश्मभ्य इव काञ्जनम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: They were talking about insane and talking to the child.The essence of the stone should be given to the stones from all sides.

Sloka: येऽर्थाः स्त्रीषु समायुक्ताः प्रमत्तपतितेषु च। ये चानार्ये समासक्ताः सर्वे ते संशयं गताः ॥
EnglishTranslation: The meanings of the women are combined with the madmen who have fallen.All those who were attached to ignoble and ignorant were in doubt.

Sloka: बलवन्तं रिपु दृष्ट् वा न वामान प्रकोपयेत् ॥
EnglishTranslation: Seeing a strong enemy, one should not be angry with the left.

Sloka: त्यजेदेकं कुलस्यार्थे ग्रामस्यार्थे कुलं त्यजेत्। ग्रामं जनपदस्यार्थे आत्मार्थे पृथिवीं त्यजेत्॥
EnglishTranslation: Leave one for the sake of the family and for the sake of the village.For the sake of the country for the sake of the country one should give up the earth for the sake of oneself

Sloka: यस्य स्नेहो भयं तस्य स्नेहो दुःखस्य भाजनम्। स्नेहमूलानि दुःखानि तानि त्यक्तवा वसेत्सुखम्॥
EnglishTranslation: The affection of one who is affectionate is the vessel of suffering.One should give up the roots of affection for the roots of affection and live happily

Sloka: अग्निदाहादपि विशिष्टं वाक्पारुष्यम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: It is also distinct from the burning of fire and is harsh in speech.

Sloka: नास्ति कामसमो व्याधिर्नास्ति मोहसमो रिपुः। नास्ति कोप समो वह्नि र्नास्ति ज्ञानात्परं सुखम्॥
EnglishTranslation: There is no disease equal to lust and no enemy equal to delusion.There is no anger equal to fire; there is no happiness greater than knowledge.

Sloka: पूर्वं निश्चित्य पश्चात् कार्यभारभेत् ॥
EnglishTranslation: After deciding in the past, one should be burdened with the weight of the work.

Sloka: श्रोतव्यं खलु वृध्दानामिति शास्त्रनिदर्शनम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: The scriptures show the scriptures that the elderly persons should hear.

Sloka: विद्वानेव विजानाति विद्वज्जन परिश्रमम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: A learned person understands the efforts of the learned.

Sloka: सत्यमेव जयते न अनृतम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: Truth alone triumphs and not lies.

Sloka: एकेनापि सुपुत्रेण विद्यायुक्ते च साधुना। आह्लादितं कुलं सर्वं यथा चन्द्रेण शर्वरी॥
EnglishTranslation: By a single good son and a saint endowed with knowledgeThe whole family was delighted like the night with the moon

Sloka: कृते प्रतिकृतिं कुर्यात् हिंसेन प्रतिहिंसनम् । तत्र दोषो न पतति दुष्टे दौष्ट्यं समाचरेत्॥
EnglishTranslation: One should repay the replica in the case of violence.There is no fault in the evil one should commit evil deeds

Sloka: दैवेन देयमिति कापुरुषा वदन्ति ॥
EnglishTranslation: The Kapurushas say that it is to be given by fate.

Sloka: समैर्विवाहः कुरुते न हीनैः समैः सख्यं व्यवहारं कथां च । गुणैर्विशिष्टांश्च पुरो दधाति विपश्चितस्तस्य नयाः सुनीताः॥
EnglishTranslation: He does not marry the same by those who are devoid of friendship, behavior and story.The wise men of his news puts the city with his virtues and distinguished the city

Sloka: धनधान्य प्रयोगेषु विद्या सङ्ग्रहेषु च। आहारे व्यवहारे च त्यक्तलज्जः सुखी भवेत्॥
EnglishTranslation: In the experiments of wealth and grain and in the collections of knowledge.He who has given up shame in food and behavior will be happy.

Sloka: जरा रुपं हरति धैर्यमाशा मृत्युः प्राणान् धर्मचर्यामसूया। कामो ह्रियं वृत्तमनार्यसेवा क्रोधः श्रियं सर्वमेवाभिमानः ॥
EnglishTranslation: Old age takes away patience, hope, death, life, righteousness, and envy.Lust is ablution, circumstances, ignorant service, anger, opulence and all pride.

Sloka: गतिरात्मवतां सन्तः सन्त एव सतां गतिः। असतां च गतिः सन्तो न त्वसन्तः सतां गतिः ॥
EnglishTranslation: The path of the self-willed is the saint and the path of the virtuous.The path of the unrighteous is not the path of the saints and the path of the virtuous is not the same.

Sloka: नास्ति भीरोः कार्यचिन्ता ॥
EnglishTranslation: There is no worry about the work of the timid.

Sloka: द्वाविमौ कण्टकौ तीक्ष्णौ शरीरपरिशोषिणौ। यश्चाधनः कामयते यश्च कुप्यत्यनीश्चरः ॥
EnglishTranslation: These two thorns are sharp and absorbed in the body.He who desires the wealth and who is angry with him

Sloka: तावन्मौनेन नीयन्ते कोकिलश्चैव वासराः । यावत्सर्वं जनानन्ददायिनी वाङ्न प्रवर्तते॥
EnglishTranslation: Meanwhile, the cuckoos are carried away by silence.Until all the words of the joy of the people are not engaged.

Sloka: श्रुतं प्रज्ञानुगं यस्य प्रज्ञा चैव श्रुतानुगा। असम्भित्रायेमर्यादः पण्डिताख्यां लभेत सः ॥
EnglishTranslation: He whose wisdom is heard, and whose wisdom is heard.A person who is not able to save himself will attain to the name of a learned man.

Sloka: शीलं प्रधानं पुरुषे तद् यस्येह प्रणश्यति। न तस्य जीवितेनार्थो न धनेन न बन्धुभिः ॥
EnglishTranslation: Character is the principal in the man, and that which is destroyed here.He has no need of his life, no wealth, no relatives.

Sloka: परोक्षे कार्यहन्तारं प्रत्यक्षे प्रियवादिनम्। वर्जयेत्तादृशं मित्रं विषकुम्भं पयोमुखम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: He kills the work in the indirect and is directly pleasant to speak.One should avoid such a friend, a poisonous pot, a milk-eater.

Sloka: जननी जन्मभूमुश्च स्वर्गादपि गरीयसी ॥
EnglishTranslation: Mother and birthplace are greater than heaven.

Sloka: सोऽस्य दोषो न मन्तव्यः क्षमा हि परमं बलम्। क्षमा गुणों ह्यशक्तानां शक्तानां भूषणं क्षमा ॥
EnglishTranslation: That is the fault of this, for forgiveness is the supreme strength.Forgiveness is the virtues of those who are incapable and forgiveness is the ornament of the powers.

Sloka: य ईर्षुः परवित्तेषु रुपे वीर्ये कुलान्वये । सुखसौभाग्यसत्कारे तस्य व्याधिरनन्तकः ॥
EnglishTranslation: He who is jealous of the wealth of others’ wealth, in the form of semen, in the family.The disease of happiness, fortune and hospitality is infinite.

Sloka: दानेन पाणिर्न तु कङ्कणेन स्नानेन शुद्धिर्न तु चन्दनेन । मानेन तृप्तिर्न तु भोजनेन ज्ञानेन मुक्तिर्न तु मण्डनेन॥
EnglishTranslation: The hand by giving, not the bracelet, the bathing, the purity, not the sandalwood.Satisfaction with respect, not by food, by knowledge, liberation, not by adornment.

Sloka: यो नोद्धतं कुरुते जातु वेषं न पौरुषेणापि विकत्थतेऽन्त्यान्। न मूर्च्छितः कटुकान्याह किञ्चित् प्रियंसदा तं कुरुते जनो हि ॥
EnglishTranslation: He who does not make the dressed in a dress, nor does he disguise the ends even by manliness.When a person is always stunned, he does not faint, for he is always pleasing to him.

Sloka: लालयेत् पंचवर्षाणि दशवर्षाणि ताडयेत्। प्राप्ते तु षोडशे वर्षे पुत्रं मित्रवदाचरेत्॥
EnglishTranslation: He should nurture for five years and beat him for ten years.At the age of sixteen years he should act like a friend

Sloka: माता यस्य गृहे नास्ति भार्या चाप्रियवादिनी। अरण्यं तेन गन्तव्यं यथारण्यं तथा गृहम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: A mother who has no mother in the house and a wife who speaks unpleasantly.He should go to the forest, just as a forest should be visited.

Sloka: तादृशी जायते बुद्धिर्व्यवसायोऽपि तादृशः। सहायास्तादृशा एव यादृशी भवितव्यता॥
EnglishTranslation: Such intelligence is born and such is such a business.The same is true of the same as the same as that of the Lord.

Sloka: कुतो विद्यार्थिनः सुखम् ॥
EnglishTranslation: Where is the happiness of the student?

Sloka: सन्तोषामृततृप्तानां यत्सुखं शान्तिरेव च। न च तद्धनलुब्धानामितश्चेतश्च धावाताम्॥
EnglishTranslation: The happiness and peace of those who are satisfied with the nectar of satisfaction.Nor should they run from here to those who are greedy for wealth.

Sloka: स्वजनं तर्पयित्वा यः शेषभोजी सोऽमृतभोजी ॥
EnglishTranslation: A person who eats the rest of his relatives and eats nectar

Sloka: यस्य कृत्यं न विघ्नन्ति शीतमुष्णं भयं रतिः । समृद्धिरसमृद्धिर्वा स वै पण्डित उच्यते ॥
EnglishTranslation: A person who does not interfere with cold, hotness, fear and passion.He is called a learned person or a person who is not rich or not.

Sloka: गुणैरुत्तमतां यान्ति नोच्चैरासनसंस्थितैः । प्रसादशिखरस्थोऽपि किं काको गरुडायते ॥
EnglishTranslation: They attain the highest state of the modes of nature, not by those who sit in a loud seat.Why does a crow, even on the peak of grace, do the crow?

Sloka: रङ्कं करोति राजानं राजानं रङ्कमेव च। धनिनं निर्धनं चैव निर्धनं धनिनं विधिः॥
EnglishTranslation: The king makes the king the king and the rankThe rich, the poor, the poor, the rich, the law.

Sloka: उपायेन हि यच्छक्यं तन्न शक्यं पराक्रमैः ॥
EnglishTranslation: Whatever is possible by means of means is not possible for prowess
